site_details: Walk in or call during designated office hours to report a found animal, inquire about a missing animal, or obtain general information. -- For after-hours emergencies call dispatch.
site_schedule: Shelter: Tues-Fri 11am-5pm -- Animal Control Dispatch: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Animal Control and Licensing: Living in City of Marion or unincorporated areas in Grant County -- All Other Services: Open

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services.
service_description: Provides public transportation services to the city of Marion through fixed route, downtown, cross-town, and express bus service.
site_details: Route maps and schedules are available at this location and online. -- DURING COVID-19 CRISIS: Call the bus terminal; reservations must be made at least 24 hours in advance.
site_schedule: Terminal: Mon-Fri 7am-5pm -- Bus Service: Days and hours vary by route; call or go online for schedule information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services.
service_description: Provides door-to-door transportation throughout the city of Marion for those with documented disabilities. Personal caregivers or assistants are permitted. All buses are fully wheelchair accessible. Registration is required before transportation may be offered.
site_details: To enroll: Visit website or walk in to obtain an application, or call the office to request that one be sent by mail. -- Return completed application in person or by mail. -- To schedule a ride (if approved): Call the bus terminal; reservations must be made at least 24 hours in advance.
site_schedule: Administrative Office: Mon-Fri 8am-3pm -- Bus Terminal: Mon-Fri 7am-5pm
site_eligibility: Living within Marion city limits -- With a documented disability that impacts transportation -- Able to get to and from the bus without assistance -OR- Able to get to and from the bus with the assistance of a personal caregiver

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services.

site_details: Call for information, to submit a request, or make a report.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Marion

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $6,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500. In Grant County, Superior Court 3 handles small claims cases.
site_details: Walk in or visit the website for claim forms.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Grant County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Grant County  -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Grant County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases, in Grant County.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutor's office, private attorneys -- individuals representing themselves.
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides probation services for the Grant County Circuit and Superior Courts, including supervising juvenile and adult offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for information.
site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the Grant County Courts

agency_desc: A nonprofit child and family advocacy agency with services throughout Indiana.
service_description: Offers statewide virtual training for persons interested in becoming licensed for foster care. Foster parents receive 24-hour staff support, counseling services, financial reimbursement, support groups, and respite care. Eligible candidates must be physically and emotionally able to handle challenges presented. Both single persons and married couples are welcome.
site_details: Visit website to complete online interest form, register for upcoming pre-service training dates, or call for information.
site_eligibility: Age 21 or older -- Able to pass a criminal history, child abuse, and sexual abuse registry check -- Able to meet state foster care licensing requirements

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that coordinates volunteer services to help with selective, minor home repair projects for households within the county.
service_description: Matches area volunteers with requests for home maintenance and small home repair projects throughout DeKalb County. (THEY DO NOT REPAIR OR DO ROOFING) Depending on available volunteers, assistance may be available for yard work, painting, cleaning, snow shoveling and electrical or plumbing work. A wait list often applies for new requests. Referrals to other resources, such as financial counseling, may be given.
site_details: Call or visit https://app.neighborlink.org/request-help/ to request assistance.
site_eligibility: Living in Grant County -- Financial need

site_details: Walk in to drop off approved recyclables; call or visit the website for more information.

agency_name: EAST CENTRAL INDIANA SOLID WASTE DISTRICT
agency_desc: A government agency that provides hazardous material management and recycling services.
service_description: Accepts hazardous waste materials from Grant County households for proper disposal. Acceptable items include oil-based paints, rechargeable and vehicle batteries, electronics, flammable liquids and solids, acids, poisons, car and light truck tires.
site_details: Drop off items during specified hours. -- Call or visit the website for more information.
site_eligibility: Grant County households (no businesses)

agency_name: BUREAU OF REHABILITATION SERVICES - INDIANA DIVISION OF DISABILITY AND REHABILITATIVE SERVICES
agency_desc: A state agency Bureau that serves persons with disabilities so that they may achieve and maintain employment.
service_description: Provides a range of employment services for persons with physical or mental impairment. Applicants receive assessment to determine eligibility and vocational rehabilitation needs. Eligible persons may receive counseling and guidance, referrals to vocational training and placement programs, and funding for rehabilitation services as appropriate to achieve an employment goal.
site_details: Call for information, to apply for services, and/or to discuss your employment needs.
site_eligibility: Have a physical or mental impairment that, based on assessment, constitutes or results in a substantial impediment to employment -- Requiring vocational rehabilitation services to prepare for, enter, engage in, or retain appropriate employment

agency_desc: Our mission is to strengthen our communities and to improve the health and well-being of those we are privileged to serve. We use evidence based practices that treat the whole person. Our team of board-certified psychiatrists and psychologists, highly trained and certified therapists, nurses, and case workers deliver comprehensive care and treatment for mental health conditions.
service_description: Provides assessment and outpatient counseling and treatment for people with substance use issues and their families. Also includes intensive outpatient services and drug screenings.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Our mission is to strengthen our communities and to improve the health and well-being of those we are privileged to serve. We use evidence based practices that treat the whole person. Our team of board-certified psychiatrists and psychologists, highly trained and certified therapists, nurses, and case workers deliver comprehensive care and treatment for mental health conditions.
service_description: Offers outpatient community based treatment for adults and youth experiencing a mental health issue or psychiatric disorder, such as anger management, anxiety, attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), bi-polar disorder, depression, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), or schizophrenia. Services include an initial assessment as well as individual, group, and/or family counseling. Case management, psychiatric medication services, home-based services, community-based psychiatric rehabilitation, supported employment services, and residential programs are available to eligible patients receiving treatment from this center.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Mon 8am-6pm, Tues 8am-8pm, Wed 7am-6pm, Thurs 7am-8pm, and Fri 8am-5pm
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides community development services.
site_name: AFFORDABLE HOUSING AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION
service_description: Provides 12 months of rental assistance and utility deposits (getting your electrical or gas hooked up) for individuals who have been incarcerated at some point and are currently facing a housing crisis of some kind. Does NOT pay for security deposits or monthly utility payments.
site_details: Have a Referral Partner (Case Manager, Probation Officer, Program Director, etc) submit the TBRA Referral Form on the website. -- If without a Referral Partner, call or email to self-refer.
site_eligibility: Currently incarcerated and exiting incarceration within 6 months -OR Currently homeless or living in transitional housing and has been incarcerated at some point -OR Experiencing a housing crisis (struggling to pay rent, at risk of eviction) and has been incarcerated at some point -- Willing to live in Grant County -- Willing to sign a one year lease -- Meet financial screening limitations -- Have a Referral Partner (Case Manager, Probation Officer, Program Director, etc.) -OR- Willing to take steps to self-refer

taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services

site_schedule: Mon-Thurs 8am-8pm; Fri 8am-noon -- Crisis Services: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- Experiencing a gambling addiction

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Grant County.
service_description: Maintains the Grant County correctional institution used to detain persons who are in lawful custody, including accused persons awaiting trial and those who have been convicted of a crime and are serving a sentence of less than one year.
site_details: Call or visit the website for scheduling details.
site_eligibility: To visit: Age 18 or older

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Grant County.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Conducts local health fairs, provides health education services to the public, and maintains the lending library and other information resources for the County.
site_details: Call for information about arranging a group presentation.
site_eligibility: Schools, community organizations, and other groups in the County

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost tuberculosis (TB) testing to persons required to take the test for work, school, or other programs as well as for those with known exposure or high risk factors.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth (through age 18) who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status. All school-required vaccines are available, as well as the HPV vaccine.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open -- Age 2 months through 18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.

Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status. All school-required vaccines are available, as well as the HPV vaccine.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Offers blood pressure screening to persons living in Grant County.
site_details: Walk in
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Coordinates lead poisoning case management for youth living within the County.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open -- Testing is recommended for any child 6 months through 6 years old who: Lives in or visits a building constructed before 1978 -Or- lives with someone who works with lead (such as a battery factory, steel smelter, stained glass) -OR- has a sibling or playmate who has been diagnosed with lead poisoning.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Offers adult vaccinations, including shingles, tetanus (Tdap), hepatitis A, and hepatitis B.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Age 19 or older -- Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Works to prevent or control the spread of communicable diseases in the County. Investigates reports of communicable diseases, provides community education programs, and offers public health nursing services.
site_details: Communicable disease investigations are generally referred through hospitals and clinics; call for additional information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides flu shots seasonally (beginning in the fall) to people age six months and older, until supplies are gone.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open -- Age 6 months or older

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides routine health and safety inspections and investigates complaints against restaurants, grocery stores, and other food service establishments in the County. agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of Grant County residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems, wells, public swimming pools, tattoo parlors, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air or water pollution, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Offers information and referrals regarding household health and environmental hazards such as mold, lead, radon, tap water contamination, mosquitoes, and rodents.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that administers housing assistance programs.
service_description: Provides subsidized, income-based rental apartments in Grant County to eligible families and persons who are elderly or disabled. Applications are accepted on a walk-in basis. A wait list is maintained when all units are full. Rent amount is equal to 30% of the resident's adjusted gross income.
site_details: Call for information or visit the website to apply; walk in to complete paperwork to be added to the wait list.
site_eligibility: Low income -- Priority given to persons 62 and older or with disabilities -- US citizens and eligible immigrants -- No rent or judgments owed to the Marion Housing Authority

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that administers housing assistance programs.
service_description: Serves as an application and recertification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program in the city of Marion in Grant County. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). The wait list for Housing CLOSED. People already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: Housing Choice Voucher wait list for Marion is currently closed. No applications are available at this time. -- Those already on the wait list should call to update contact information as needed.
site_eligibility: Income guidelines will be reviewed once application reaches the top of the wait list. Preference is given to working families.

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call or send an email to request an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering social, recreational, and educational activities for seniors and older adults.
service_description: Offers social, recreational, and educational activities for area seniors. Services may include health screenings, computer classes, and fitness programs.
site_details: Call or walk in for information or assistance.
site_eligibility: Age 50 or older

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering social, recreational, and educational activities for seniors and older adults.
service_description: Offers a lunch each weekday to seniors. Reservations are required.
site_details: Call during office hours to make a reservation -- Requests must be made at least 24 hours in advance of desired meal.
site_eligibility: Age 50 or older

agency_name: MEALS ON WHEELS OF GRANT COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that delivers nutritional meals to the residences of those unable to provide such for themselves due to illness or disability.
site_name: MEALS ON WHEELS OF GRANT COUNTY
service_description: Delivers a cold lunch and a hot, evening meal each weekday to homebound individuals who are unable to cook for themselves. Regular and special diets are available. Limited service area.
site_details: Call to arrange a phone interview; clients will be asked to provide the name of an emergency contact and their physician. -- Agency may have a waiting list depending on availability of volunteer drivers.
site_eligibility: Homebound due to age or disability -- Unable to prepare own meals

site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call or send an email to request an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit organization offering charitable outreach, including limited financial assistance and a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and  nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in to register
site_eligibility: Not received food assistance from this pantry within the past 60 days

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit organization offering charitable outreach, including limited financial assistance and a food pantry.
service_description: Provides holiday clothing and gift assistance for eligible Grant County children in need. Distribution information will be provided during application process to families who are approved for the program.
site_details: Walk in to apply
site_schedule: Applications: Oct 11th-14th and Oct 18th-Oct 21st; Wed-Thurs 10am-2pm; Sat 4pm-6pm
site_eligibility: Living in Grant County -- Household income at or below 150% of the Federal Poverty Level -- With children ages 12 or younger

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit organization offering charitable outreach, including limited financial assistance and a food pantry.
service_description: Provides limited financial assistance for rent, electric, gas, and heating fuel bills that are active and in the disconnect status. Participants must complete two budgeting classes. Assistance is determined on a case-by-case basis and depends on funding availability.
site_details: Go to the website to fill out application and submit it. Salvation Army reviews your application and calls you back.
site_eligibility: Household income at or below 150% of the Federal Poverty Level -- Utility account is active and in the disconnect status -- Not received financial assistance from this agency within the past 12 months

agency_name: SERVICES FOR VISUALLY AND HEARING IMPAIRED
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization assisting those with visual or hearing impairment through counseling and educational services.
site_name: SERVICES FOR VISUALLY AND HEARING IMPAIRED
service_description: Provides assistance and support to those with a visual or hearing impairment. Services may include counseling, independent life-skills instruction, and orientation or mobility training.  Financial assistance to obtain prescription eyeglasses and hearing aids is also available.
site_details: Call or walk in for assistance.
site_eligibility: Visually and/or hearing impaired -- For Financial Assistance: At or below 200% poverty level

agency_desc: A nonprofit Christian housing ministry that builds and renovates affordable housing for qualified individuals and families.
service_description: Builds and rehabilitates homes for eligible low-income persons in Grant County. Participants contribute a set number of hours of labor toward the construction of a dwelling that they may then purchase through an affordable loan. Volunteer opportunities are also available for interested individuals and service groups.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment for an information session to receive an application; may need to leave a message.
site_eligibility: Worked in Grant County for at least 1 full year -- Household income between 30%-60% of area median -- Stable employment or other source of income for at least one year -- Currently have reasonably good credit

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_schedule: Mon and Wed noon-7pm; Fri 11am-5pm; Sat noon-4pm
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living, working, or owning property in the town of Swayzee and Sims Township

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Marion in Grant County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Marion in Grant County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call Marion city dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades PreK-12
